Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a path consisting of a sequence of map locations represented by GPS coordinates (longitude and latitude).
    Version:
    02/27/12
    Author:
    Chun-Wei Chen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double RADIUS 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Path(double lon, double lat)
      Constructs a Path with the specified starting location.
      Path(Path p)
      Constructs a Path that is a duplicate (a deep copy) of the one provided without modifying p.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean appendLocation(double lon, double lat)
      Adds a new location to the end of this Path.
      Path createReversePath()
      Returns a new Path object that represents this path with all locations visited in reverse order.
      boolean deleteLocation(double lon, double lat)
      If a location with the specified longitude and latitude exists in this Path, delete that location.
      double distanceToClosestStop(double lon, double lat)
      Finds the stop on this Path that is closest to the location provided as a parameter and return the distance between the location and that stop in kilometers.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Returns true if the object provided as a parameter is the same as this path.
      boolean insertLocation(double lon, double lat)
      Adds a new location to this Path.
      static Path joinPaths(Path a, Path b)
      Returns a new Path that contains the sequence of locations in Path 'a' followed by those in Path 'b' without modifying a or b.
      int locations()
      Returns the number of locations (stops) on this Path.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Represnts the Path as a sequence of GPS locations in String.
      double totalPathLength()
      Returns the total distance traveled by following this Path in kilometers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Path

        public Path(double lon,
    double lat)
        Constructs a Path with the specified starting location.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of the location
        lat - latitude of the location
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either lon < -180, lon > 180, or lat < -90 or lat > 90

      • Path

        public Path(Path p)
        Constructs a Path that is a duplicate (a deep copy) of the one provided without modifying p.
        Parameters:
        p - original script of the path
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p references to null

    • Method Detail

      • locations

        public int locations()
        Returns the number of locations (stops) on this Path.
        Returns:
        the number of locations (stops) on this Path

      • appendLocation

        public boolean appendLocation(double lon,
                     double lat)
        Adds a new location to the end of this Path. Doesnt't add if the location would be an adjacent duplicate. Throws exception if the argument is not legal.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of the location
        lat - latitude of the location
        Returns:
        true if the location is added to the path
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either lon < -180, lon > 180, or lat < -90 or lat > 90

      • insertLocation

        public boolean insertLocation(double lon,
                     double lat)
        Adds a new location to this Path. The new location should be inserted in the sequence such that it creates the smallest possible increase in total path length.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of the location
        lat - latitude of the location
        Returns:
        true if the location is added to the path
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either lon < -180, lon > 180, or lat < -90 or lat > 90

      • deleteLocation

        public boolean deleteLocation(double lon,
                     double lat)
        If a location with the specified longitude and latitude exists in this Path, delete that location. Return true if the path was changed, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of the location
        lat - latitude of the location
        Returns:
        true if the path was changed

      • totalPathLength

        public double totalPathLength()
        Returns the total distance traveled by following this Path in kilometers.
        Returns:
        the total distance traveled by following this Path in kilometers.

      • distanceToClosestStop

        public double distanceToClosestStop(double lon,
                           double lat)
        Finds the stop on this Path that is closest to the location provided as a parameter and return the distance between the location and that stop in kilometers.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of the location
        lat - latitude of the location
        Returns:
        the distance between the location and the closest location in the Path
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either lon < -180, lon > 180, or lat < -90 or lat > 90

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if the object provided as a parameter is the same as this path.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - an Object
        Returns:
        true if o is the same as this path

      • createReversePath

        public Path createReversePath()
        Returns a new Path object that represents this path with all locations visited in reverse order.
        Returns:
        the new Path object with the reverse order

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Represnts the Path as a sequence of GPS locations in String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the Path

      • joinPaths

        public static Path joinPaths(Path a,
             Path b)
        Returns a new Path that contains the sequence of locations in Path 'a' followed by those in Path 'b' without modifying a or b.
        Parameters:
        a - the first Path
        b - the second Path
        Returns:
        the new Path object contains all the locations in Path 'a' followed by all the locations in Path 'b' without modifying a or b
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either a or b references to null
